content: उत्खात {%<ab>p. p.</ab>%} {@--1@} Excavated, dug up. {@--2@} Extracted, drawn out; उत्खातं परित्यागशल्यं <ls>U. 3.</ls> {@--3@} Uprooted, plucked up by the roots (<ab>lit.</ab>); लीला° uprooted in sport <ls>U. 3. 16</ls>; <ls>Māl. 9. 34.</ls> {@--4@} (<ab>fig.</ab>) ({%a%}) Eradicated, totally destroyed, annihilated; किमुत्खातं नंदवंशस्य <ls>Mu. 1</ls>; °लवणो मधुरेश्वरः प्राप्तः <ls>U. 7.</ls> ({%b%}) Deposed, deprived of power or authority; फलैः संवर्धयामासुरुत्खातप्रतिरोपिताः <ls>R. 4. 37</ls> (where उत्खात means ‘uprooted’ also). --तं A hole, cavity, hollow, uneven ground; अनुत्खातस्तिमित not stopped by uneven ground; <ls>Ś. 7. 33.</ls>
